description: 共同科英文（二）課程為一學期兩學分課程，係為非英語系學生所開設的課程。目標在幫助大一學生活用中學時期所累積的英語知識，提昇英語聽、說、讀、寫整體的溝通能力。為達此目標，本課程要求教師盡量用英語上課，努力營造一個豐富的英語環境，讓學生不但有充分機會以英語參與課堂活動，且樂於使用英語與同學及老師溝通。
goals: 1. 增進學生英語溝通表達能力 2. 透過參與課程活動促進團隊精神 3. 透過多面向英語閱讀促使學生了解多元文化，拓展學生國際化視野 4. 透過課堂討論培養批判精神 5. 提升學生英語學習動機及自主學習興趣
syllabus:
**National Taiwan Normal University**

**General English II**

**Spring 2022**

**Class time:** Friday 3-4

**Instructor:** Jyun-Yu Li (李俊鈺)

**Email:** anguslee0602@gmail.com

**Course description**

This course aims to enhance students’ English productive and receptive skills. In class, you will be given opportunity to integrate the four skills to achieve different types of learning tasks, for example, oral presentation, summary writing, etc.

**Textbook**

Keynote 4

**Grading policy**

1\. Attendance 10%

Students are expected to attend each class. However, you are allowed to be absent **no more than** three classes. Each absence must be legitimate. Points will be deducted once you are absent more than three classes.

2\. In-class discussion and participation (quality talk) 20%

  During the class, you will read a variety of articles, discuss them, and learn how to raise questions and to respond to teacher- or peer-initiated questions. Active participation is highly encouraged.

3\. Mid-term exam: 3-minute oral presentation 30% (oral presentation 15%; written report 15%)

  (a) Decide your own topic.

  (b) You are required to make PowerPoint slides to help your audience understand your talk.

  (c) After the mid-term exam, you are required to submit a report. The elements of the report should include: (1) the topic of your peer’s talk (2) feedback (e.g., how do you feel about your peer’s talk? What are your peer’s strengths or weaknesses?) **(Format: Times New Roman, font size: 12, 120-150 words)**

4\. Final exam-oral presentation: 20% (oral presentation 10%; written report 10%)

(a) You will give a three-minute oral presentation based upon the book of your choice from Lexile.

(b) You are required to make PowerPoint slides to help your audience understand your talk.

(c) After the final exam, you are required to submit a report. The elements of the report should include: (1) the topic of your peer’s talk (2) feedback (e.g., how do you feel about your peer’s talk? What are your peer’s strengths or weaknesses?) **(Format: Times New Roman, font size: 12, 120-150 words)**

5\. TOEIC Listening and Reading Test: 20%

6\. Bonus: If you attend any English competitions hosted by NTNU, additional **five** points will be added to your final grades.
